title: Classification of information
text: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.
summary: Requires the implementation of metadata tagging or labeling capabilities within information systems to handle data classification levels.

title: Information transfer
text: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.
summary: Requires secure protocols (e.g., TLS, SFTP) and encryption mechanisms for data in transit between internal and external systems.

title: Access control
text: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
summary: Requires the implementation of logical access control mechanisms (authentication and authorization gates) for information systems.

title: Identity management
text: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.
summary: Requires software processes for provisioning, modifying, and de-provisioning user identities and accounts.

title: Authentication information
text: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.
summary: Requires technical controls for managing credentials, such as password complexity enforcement, rotation, and secure storage (hashing/salting).

title: Access rights
text: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization’s topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
summary: Requires systems to support granular permission assignment, modification, and revocation (RBAC/ABAC).

title: Information security for use of cloud services
text: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization’s information security requirements.
summary: Requires secure configuration, access management, and segregation of data within cloud service environments.

title: Collection of evidence
text: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.
summary: Requires logging and data retention capabilities that ensure integrity for forensic analysis during incident response.

title: ICT readiness for business continuity
text: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.
summary: Requires high availability, failover mechanisms, and redundancy configurations in software architecture to support business continuity.

title: Protection of records
text: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.
summary: Requires mechanisms to ensure data integrity and immutability for critical records and logs.

title: Privacy and protection of personal identifiable information (PII)
text: The organization shall identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.
summary: Requires technical controls such as encryption, anonymization, and strict access controls for PII data.

title: Remote working
text: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization’s premises.
summary: Requires secure remote access technologies (VPN, MFA) and endpoint security controls.

title: Clear desk and clear screen
text: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.
summary: Requires implementation of automatic session locking and screen timeouts for user endpoints.

title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
text: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
summary: Requires software tools or utilities to securely wipe or overwrite storage media to prevent data recovery.

title: User end point devices
text: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user end point devices shall be protected.
summary: Requires endpoint protection software, disk encryption, and configuration management on user devices.

title: Privileged access rights
text: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
summary: Requires strict enforcement of principle of least privilege and Privileged Access Management (PAM) controls.

title: Information access restriction
text: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
summary: Requires technical implementation of Access Control Lists (ACLs) and network segmentation to restrict data access.

title: Access to source code
text: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.
summary: Requires version control system permissions and access controls for code repositories.

title: Secure authentication
text: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
summary: Requires implementation of Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and secure login protocols.

title: Capacity management
text: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.
summary: Requires system monitoring tools to track resource usage and enable scaling or alerting.

title: Protection against malware
text: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
summary: Requires implementation of anti-malware software, EDR solutions, and automated scanning.

title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
text: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization’s exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
summary: Requires automated vulnerability scanning and patch management systems.

title: Configuration management
text: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
summary: Requires configuration management tools to enforce security baselines and detect drift.

title: Information deletion
text: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media shall be deleted when no longer required.
summary: Requires automated data retention policies and secure deletion mechanisms within applications.

title: Data masking
text: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization’s topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
summary: Requires implementation of dynamic masking, pseudonymization, or redaction of sensitive data in views and logs.

title: Data leakage prevention
text: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.
summary: Requires DLP solutions to monitor and block unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive data.

title: Information backup
text: Backup copies of information, software and systems shall be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.
summary: Requires automated backup solutions and restoration testing capabilities.

title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
text: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.
summary: Requires failover clusters, load balancing, and redundant infrastructure components.

title: Logging
text: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
summary: Requires comprehensive audit logging, centralized log storage, and protection against log tampering.

title: Monitoring activities
text: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
summary: Requires monitoring tools (IDS/IPS/SIEM) to detect and alert on anomalous security events.

title: Clock synchronization
text: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.
summary: Requires configuration of NTP (Network Time Protocol) to ensure consistent timestamps across all systems.

title: Use of privileged utility programs
text: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.
summary: Requires restrictions on the installation and execution of powerful system utilities and debuggers.

title: Installation of software on operational systems
text: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.
summary: Requires mechanisms like allowlisting or software restriction policies to control software installation.

title: Networks security
text: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
summary: Requires firewall configurations, secure routing, and network device hardening.

title: Security of network services
text: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services shall be identified, implemented and monitored.
summary: Requires verification and monitoring of security controls within network services (e.g., DNSSEC, VPN).

title: Segregation of networks
text: Groups of information services, users and information systems shall be segregated in the organization’s networks.
summary: Requires network separation using VLANs, subnets, or virtual networks to isolate assets.

title: Web filtering
text: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.
summary: Requires implementation of web proxies, DNS filtering, or URL blocking tools.

title: Use of cryptography
text: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
summary: Requires correct implementation of encryption algorithms and secure key management lifecycles.

title: Secure development life cycle
text: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.
summary: Requires integration of security gates and tools (SAST/DAST) into the software development lifecycle.

title: Application security requirements
text: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.
summary: Requires defining non-functional security requirements (NFRs) for applications.

title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
text: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.
summary: Requires strict adherence to secure design patterns (e.g., defense in depth, fail secure) in system architecture.

title: Secure coding
text: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
summary: Requires adherence to secure coding standards (e.g., OWASP) to prevent common vulnerabilities like SQLi and XSS.

title: Security testing in development and acceptance
text: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.
summary: Requires execution of security tests (penetration testing, scanning) prior to production deployment.

title: Separation of development, test and production environments
text: Development, testing and production environments shall be separated and secured.
summary: Requires logical and network isolation between dev, test, and production environments.

title: Change management
text: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.
summary: Requires automated CI/CD pipelines and gated check-ins to control software changes.

title: Test information
text: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
summary: Requires use of sanitized or synthetic data in testing environments; prohibits production data use without masking.

title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
text: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
summary: Requires systems to support read-only access or isolated clones for auditing to prevent operational disruption.
